required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Predictive Factors for Postoperative Pain, Nausea and Vomiting in Oncological Patients
clinical_study.official_title: Evaluation of Predictive Factors for Nausea, Vomiting and Postoperative Acute Pain in Oncological Patients

lead_sponsor.agency: Instituto do Cancer do Estado de São Paulo

clinical_study.source: Instituto do Cancer do Estado de São Paulo

brief_summary.textblock: 1809 patients were evaluated in postoperative period. They were asked about nausea, vomiting, retching and pain in the first postoperative 24 hours

detailed_description.textblock: Patients were prospectively evaluated , and nausea, vomiting and pain were recorded.

primary_outcome.description: pain intensity was measured using descriptive and verbal number scale

secondary_outcome.description: nausea, vomiting, pruritus and hypotension were measured during first 24 postoperative hours

intervention.description: Patients will be observed during postoperative period,

study_pop.textblock: Patients submitted to oncological surgeries in a specialized Hospital

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- patients submitted to oncological surgeries
Exclusion Criteria:
- refusal to sign the agreement term
- lack of information in the records

reference.citation: Lee SY, Hung CJ, Chen CC, Wu CC. Survival analysis of postoperative nausea and vomiting in patients receiving patient-controlled epidural analgesia. J Chin Med Assoc. 2014 Nov;77(11):589-93. doi: 10.1016/j.jcma.2014.08.008. Epub 2014 Sep 22.

Gramke HF, de Rijke JM, van Kleef M, Kessels AG, Peters ML, Sommer M, Marcus MA. Predictive factors of postoperative pain after day-case surgery. Clin J Pain. 2009 Jul-Aug;25(6):455-60. doi: 10.1097/AJP.0b013e31819a6e34.
